comment: Professor Allen is a great teacher. I highly recommend his class to everyone. He does expect you to be in class and participate in discussions. His tests are short answer, but if you come to class and use his study guide you will be fine. Don't miss out on a great learning opportunity.
Very nice guy. A little difficult to understand at times, but his class is super easy.

He?s a very nice man and is interesting. Make sure to read the material because he wants class participation. His map test are EASY so just study and he grades much harder on the papers than he leads you to believe so really out time into those papers

I took Dr. Allen for History of West Africa. He  is really passionate about the class.  If you didn't read or work on homework, then you struggled. As far as the comments on here about him being hard, this is COLLEGE, if you aren't willing to WORK for your grade, then maybe you should drop out now. No one ever said College was easy.

Very nice guy.  Horrible teacher! Do not take this class! Powerpoints were useless, lectures were not clear, reviews were vague, final's "study guide" was not helpful at all! He told us that the study guide was based on the answers and we went over it in class, students answered and he told us that's all we needed to know. HE LIED! failed final

He's an awesome guy. Very boring lecture, though. There are only 2 tests and one is the final. He gives various geography quizzes once a month. He requires weekly current events. Overall the class is easy, but extremely boring.

DO NOT TAKE THIS FOOL!!!!he clearly knows very little of what he teaches and is very annoying!! he is disorganized and is constantly contradicting himself!!!!! worst prof i have ever had!! i LOVE history, and i am a history major...but he bores the crap out of me and i honestly have learned zip from his class!!!

ok,so I fall asleep everyday in class and I have an A..the class is very easy,but be warned..he is EXTREMELY annoying.class is basically powerpoint and the stuff you need for the tests are not in them.you have to teach yourself,but for the most part the quizzes are nothing but maps.By the way,he is EXTREMELY annoying and prob should not be teaching

The worst!!! RUN NOW!! He does not teach! He grades everyone differently and counts spelling of these long African names on test. We had three papers we had to submit online. i did not get any grades back until the last week of school! SUPER UNFAIR. sometimes he would read the paper and tell the class to answer questions in a group. or call on peop
worst prof i have ever had..can not believe i wasted my money on this guy

Dr. Allen is a wonderful professor! I think there were 3 or 4 tests, 3 papers, and a presentation. Tests and quizzes were extremely specific--needed to know dates, names, etc. But there were numerous opportunities for extra credit and Dr. Allen was always available for consultation. Definitely recommend him and plan to take him again.

AVOID TAKING HIM AT ALL COST. i never got a grade higher than 74 on ANYTHING in this class. His notes and powerpoints do nothing to prepare you for tests. Study in ADVANCE for the map quizzes- only thing to boost your grade. Take advantage of ANY Extra credit For tests, read chapters thoroughly.Only buy the history book the guide to writing=useless

Great teacher. Very knowledgeable. If you participate during class discussions, he will like you a lot more. Map quizzes are easy 100's and goes over what is going to be on test before exam. Also, gives a max of 10 points extra credit on final overall average.
DON'T take him. Enough said - read the other people's comments.

SO FRUSTRATING. its almost pure luck if you pass this class. the only good thing were the map quizes which were an easy A if you study them. the tests are VERY detailed and precise about the material, and the lectures literally teach you nothing. he tells you to go home and read about it and lets you out early.

Class was ridiculous. I'm sure Allen is a great guy outside the classroom, but the class was pointless. The classes were powerpoints that are nothing of lists of what you need to teach yourself at home. The tests were multiple choice and essay. Map quizzes every other week-ish (this was history...not geography). A novel to read too

Professor Allen's style of teaching is odd, but if you embrace it, it works well. I had him for History of West Africa, and he is Liberian and obviously has a very good grasp on the material. His lectures are pretty much "Know these things:" so pay close attention to what he says, and read just these things-it will cut down on the amount of reading

hard to get an A.His quiz reviews are posted at the beginning of the year, so if you dont make 100's then I can see how its the students fault.Test are from minor book details,READ THE BOOD!And he grades paragraphs that he had all semester w/o any justification.I made 4 A's this semester on test/quizes but I will only make a B in the classes b/c pa

Mr. Allen is a nice person..but his teaching skills are HORRIBLE!!! He is very unorganized and his test focus on the most minor details..His lectures are a waste of time. And he makes you do 7 paragraphs throughout the class that he doesnt even check..DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!!

He's overall a nice guy. Must attend every class. He gives assignments, map quizzes, and then tests throughout the semester. No extra credit. Map quizzes are okay. Tests are hard! Must study in advance from the test to even pass it. Multiple choice tets with an essay. Multiple choice questions are based on the answer that HE thinks is the best.

Allen is a nice guy but he is not a great teacher. He never explains anything and does not review topics unless you ask him about it first. This class requires a lot of self teaching. His tests are tricky but doable if you READ THE BOOK! If you write well you will get full points on essay questions.

I had to drop the class because I was failing. His tests only have about 15 questions on them plus essay. He doesn't teach in class, he just flies through and says, "This is important - go read it at home." The test questions are mostly trick questions as well. Don't take him.

Allen makes history awful.  His tests are impossible, and he doesn't give a study guide.  Correction:  His study guide consists of you going to class and him saying, "you should know everything".  He's awful.  I was in a large class, and I would say at least 90% of us didn't like his teaching. Save yourself.  Don't take his class.
He's an "okay" professor. He grades very harshly and he points out bad grammer and misspellings. you learn more from the book than in class. Don't take unless you're willing to work like crazy!
He is a tough professor and he grades hard, but I did okay in the class.  JUST STUDY!!!

Dr. Allen refers to himself in the 3rd person which is weird. He requires a lot of reading and very little information during lectures. He gives you crazy info that is not used on the test. He does not provide info in class. The students do. You must know how to read and take notes bc he won't teach you.

interesting lectures. a lot of grades/tests/quizzes. very traditional style of teaching but really into discussion on WHY history happens the way it does. Will help you out if you go to him after class.

Great teacher.I took him during summer semester so he took out the paper. Always willing to help out when I had to miss a class. The map quizzes were extremely easy and the group project turned out to be no big deal. Answers on the test are straight out of the textbook, you don't even need to take notes, just read the chapters! They are very short.

VERY intelligent man. Tests are multiple choice & essay-not easy. Map quizzes are very unclear & extremely hard. Oral presentation, a paper about a book. 4 texts total. Lectures are extremely boring-if youre not a history buff you will spend your time staring at the clock. Some extra credit. I hated this class, but then again I dont enjoy history.
